byline.contributor: Research was contributed by Megan Thee-Brenan and Zachary Wichter.

abstract: Jim Rutenberg Mediator column calls for moderators of upcoming debate between presidential nominees to interject with truth when either Donald J Trump or Hillary Clinton makes obvious false statement; suggests this is perfect chance for journalists to redeem themselves after failing time after time to point out misinformation uttered during election campaign, allowing public to digest lies as fact.
lead_paragraph: News outlets and fact-checking sites can separate truth from fable after a debate, but it falls to the moderator to interject in the moment when a candidate lies.
snippet: News outlets and fact-checking sites can separate truth from fable after a debate, but it falls to the moderator to interject in the moment when a candidate lies....

headline.main: A Moment of Truth for Presidential Debate Moderators
headline.print_headline: A Moment  of Truth  for Debate  Moderators
